Package tools.data.img

Class SubImageSheet

  • java.lang.Object
    • tools.data.img.ImageSheet
      • tools.data.img.BoundedImageSheet
        • tools.data.img.SubImageSheet
  • public class SubImageSheet
extends BoundedImageSheet
    Bounded image sheet class which creates a translated sub-view from another image sheet.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class tools.data.img.ImageSheet

    • Constructor Detail

      • SubImageSheet

        public SubImageSheet​(ImageSheet sheet,
                     int sheetWidth,
                     int sheetHeight)
        Creates a new image sheet which uses a translated view of the given image sheet. The sub-image has the given width and height and the underlaying images are directly fetched from the given sheet.
        Parameters:
        sheet - The original image sheet to get all images from.
        sheetWidth - The width of the sheet (in images).
        sheetHeight - The height of the sheet (in images).
        See Also:
        SubImageSheet(tools.data.img.ImageSheet, int, int, int, int)

      • SubImageSheet

        public SubImageSheet​(ImageSheet sheet,
                     int transX,
                     int transY,
                     int sheetWidth,
                     int sheetHeight)
        Creates a new image sheet which uses a translated view of the given image sheet. The sub-image has the given width and height and the underlaying images are directly fetched from the given sheet. Moreover, the indices are translated by the given translations.
        Parameters:
        sheet - The original image sheet to get all images from.
        transX - The amount to translate the original image sheet in the x-axis (in images).
        transY - The amount to translate the original image sheet in the y-axis (in images).
        sheetWidth - The width of the sheet (in images).
        sheetHeight - The height of the sheet (in images).
        See Also:
        setSize(int, int), setTranslate(int, int)

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Description copied from class: BoundedImageSheet
        Returns the number of images which are in the width of the image sheet.
        Specified by:
        getWidth in class BoundedImageSheet
        Returns:
        The width of the sheet, counted as the number of images, or -1 if this function is not supported.

      • get

        public java.awt.Image get​(int x,
                          int y,
                          int width,
                          int height,
                          int scaleHints)
        Description copied from class: ImageSheet
        Returns the scaled image at (x, y).
        Overrides:
        get in class ImageSheet
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the image to get.
        y - The y-coordinate of the image to get.
        width - The width of the image to return. -1 if the default width should be used.
        height - The height of the image to return. -1 if the default height should be used.
        scaleHints - The scale hints used for scaling the image.
        Returns:
        The image sheet at (x, y) with the given width and height, and scaled using the scale hints.
        See Also:
        ImageSheet.get(int, int), Image.getScaledInstance(int, int, int)

      • getSheet

        public java.awt.Image[][] getSheet()
        Description copied from class: ImageSheet
        Returns the underlaying source image sheet.
        This function should in general not be used as special value and exception handling cannot be done here.]
        Specified by:
        getSheet in class ImageSheet
        Returns:
        The image sheet described by this object, or null if not supported.

      • draw

        public boolean draw​(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d,
                    int x,
                    int y,
                    int posX,
                    int posY)
             throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Description copied from class: ImageSheet
        Draws the image at (x, y) at the given coordinates (posX, posY).
        Overrides:
        draw in class ImageSheet
        Parameters:
        g2d - The graphics object used to draw on.
        x - The x-coordinate of the image on the sheet to use.
        y - The y-coordinate of the image on the sheet to use.
        posX - The amount to translate the image in the x-axis.
        posY - The amount to translate the image in the y-axis.
        Returns:
        true if anything was drawn on the graphics object. false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the given indices x and y are out of bounds.
        See Also:
        ImageSheet.get(int, int)

      • draw

        public boolean draw​(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d,
                    int x,
                    int y,
                    int posX,
                    int posY,
                    int width,
                    int height,
                    int scaleHints)
             throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Description copied from class: ImageSheet
        Resizes the image at (x, y) to the size (width x height) and draws it at the given coordinates (posX, posY).
        Overrides:
        draw in class ImageSheet
        Parameters:
        g2d - The graphics object used to draw on.
        x - The x-coordinate of the image on the sheet to use.
        y - The y-coordinate of the image on the sheet to use.
        posX - The amount to translate the image in the x-axis.
        posY - The amount to translate the image in the y-axis.
        width - The width of the image to draw.
        height - The height of the image to draw.
        scaleHints - The scale hints used for scaling the image.
        Returns:
        true if anything was drawn on the graphics object. false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the given indices x and y are out of bounds.
        See Also:
        ImageSheet.get(int, int, int, int, int)

      • setXTranslate

        public void setXTranslate​(int x)
        Sets the amount the sub-view should be translated to the x-axis.

        Example:
        The three images in the following example access the same element in the sheet: 
             SubImageSheet sheet = ...;
     Image img0 = sheet.get(0, 0);
     sheet.setXTranslate(1);
     Image img1 = sheet.get(1, 0);
     sheet.setXTranslate(2);
     Image img2 = sheet.get(2, 0);
        Parameters:
        x - The new amount the sub-view should be translated to the x-axis.
        See Also:
        setTranslate(int, int)

      • setYTranslate

        public void setYTranslate​(int y)
        Sets the amount the sub-view should be translated to the y-axis.

        Example:
        The three images in the following example access the same element in the sheet: 
             SubImageSheet sheet = ...;
     Image img0 = sheet.get(0, 0);
     sheet.setYTranslate(1);
     Image img1 = sheet.get(0, 1);
     sheet.setYTranslate(2);
     Image img2 = sheet.get(0, 2);
        Parameters:
        y - The new amount the sub-view should be translated to the y-axis.
        See Also:
        setTranslate(int, int)

      • setTranslate

        public void setTranslate​(int x,
                         int y)
        Sets the amount the sub-view should be translated to the x- and y-axis.

        Example:
        The three images in the following example access the same element in the sheet: 
             SubImageSheet sheet = ...;
     Image img0 = sheet.get(0, 0);
     sheet.setTranslate(1, 2);
     Image img1 = sheet.get(1, 2);
     sheet.setTranslate(4, 5);
     Image img2 = sheet.get(4, 5);
        Parameters:
        x - The new amount the sub-view should be translated to the x-axis.
        y - The new amount the sub-view should be translated to the y-axis.

      • translateX

        public void translateX​(int x)
        Moves the sub-view along the x-axis.

        Example:
        The three images in the following example access the same element in the sheet: 
             SubImageSheet sheet = ...;
     Image img0 = sheet.get(0, 0);
     sheet.translateX(2);
     Image img1 = sheet.get(2, 0);
     sheet.translateX(1);
     Image img2 = sheet.get(3, 0);
        Parameters:
        x - The amount to translate the sub-view to the x-axis.
        See Also:
        translate(int, int)

      • translateY

        public void translateY​(int y)
        Moves the sub-view along the y-axis.

        Example:
        The three images in the following example access the same element in the sheet: 
             SubImageSheet sheet = ...;
     Image img0 = sheet.get(0, 0);
     sheet.translateY(2);
     Image img1 = sheet.get(0, 2);
     sheet.translateY(1);
     Image img2 = sheet.get(0, 3);
        Parameters:
        y - The amount to translate the sub-view to the y-axis.
        See Also:
        translate(int, int)

      • translate

        public void translate​(int x,
                      int y)
        Moves the sub-view along the x- and y-axis.

        Example:
        The three images in the following example access the same element in the sheet: 
             SubImageSheet sheet = ...;
     Image img0 = sheet.get(0, 0);
     sheet.translate(1, 2);
     Image img1 = sheet.get(1, 2);
     sheet.translateY(3, 4);
     Image img2 = sheet.get(4, 6);
        Parameters:
        x - The amount to translate the sub-view to the x-axis.
        y - The amount to translate the sub-view to the y-axis.
